quotes.quote: Television is a populous, derivative, democratic medium.
Television is a medium because anything well done is rare.
Television is like the invention of indoor plumbing. It didn't change people's habits. It just kept them inside the house.
Television probably has become the most evocative, widely observed signpost we have.
Today, watching television often means fighting, violence and foul language â€“ and that's just deciding who gets to hold the remote control.
Television is the triumph of machine over people.
Good journalism, good television, can make our world a better place.
Television is an instrument which can paralyze this country.
Television could perform a great service in mass education, but there's no indication its sponsors have anything like this on their minds.
Television has proved that people will look at anything rather than each other.
Television provides the opportunity for an ongoing story, the opportunity to meld the cast and the characters and a world, and to spend more time there.
I find television very educating. Every time somebody turns on the set, I go into the other room and read a book.
Television is more interesting than people.Â  If it were not, we should have people standing in the corners of our rooms.Â
Television enjoys a de facto monopoly on what goes into the heads of a significant part of the population and what they think.
Network television has been attempting to lure viewers for years with its low-interest programming only to have those viewers discover later that their brains are bankrupt.
All television is educational television. The question is: what is it teaching?
TelevisionÂ is the most perfect democracy. You sit there with your remote control and vote.
Television is a gold goose that lays scrambled eggs; and it is futile and probably fatal to beat it for not laying caviar.
Television has done much for psychiatry by spreading information about it, as well as contributing to the need for it.
Television has made dictatorship impossible, but democracy unbearable.
Television contracts the imagination and radio expands it.
Television is simply automated daydreaming.
Television is like the American toaster, you push the button and the same thing pops up everytime.
Television is chewing gum for the eyes.
Television has been the single greatest shaper of emptiness.
The most corrosive piece of technology that I've ever seen is called television â€“ but then again, television, at its best, is magnificent.
Television is by nature the dominator drug par excellence. Control of content, uniformity of content, repeatability of content make it inevitably a tool of coercion, brainwashing, and manipulation.
All you see on television are debased images.
In television, everything is gone with the speed of light, literally. It is no field for anybody with intimations of immortality.
Television is actually closer to reality than anything in books. The madness of TV is the madness of human life.
